item.title: Pedestrian path dirty and slipery, unsafe to use, 1st December
item.description:
A lot of wet leaves on a path, could be this clean please, I slippered and now barely can walk :(

item.title: They is numerous area, 1st December
item.description:
They is always large dog poo outside my gate. It is happening daily now and it is disgusting. I have small children and we shouldn’t have to dodge poo every morning noon and night. It is so bad I have to advise guests to avoid it when visiting.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ickburgh Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged brickwork to planter, 1st December
item.description:
Located at top (north end ) of Huddleston Road N7 - (adjacent Station Road N19) & near the entrance to IQ Tufnell Park student hall of residence. - Evidently, a vehicle has backed into this brick wall & pushed over the top few courses of yellow brickwork - The planter has remained in this condition for several months (spring & summer 2025)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Huddleston Road, Archway, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grafitti, 1st December
item.description:

item.title: Facing Heaven yet again with waste management issues, 1st December
item.description:
Their private back garden that’s visible to local residents is always disgusting and overflowing. They also always leave their restaurant garbage bags on the street and they get ripped apart on left everywhere. Their £20k fine didn’t change their behaviour

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bayford Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Leaves causing a hazard on the pavements, 1st December
item.description:
Once again the council have not cleared leaves on a regular basis. It’s now been almost a month since anyone cleared the pavements. The plane trees in Kings Hall Road are enormous snd receive no care and so the quantity of leaves is absurd. The sheer volume of leaves is a concern when the pavements are twisted with roots and now with the wet weather it has all become a dangerous hazard. Please send someone to clear the leaves this week before someone has a nasty accident outside on the pavement which is on a school, commuter and nursery route. Can you please give your assurance that we can have these pavements cleared and cleaned regularly rather than having to report the issue constantly. I would assume that a portion of our council tax is paying for clearance and so why isn’t it being done?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kings Hall Road, New Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping again, 1st December
item.description:
Always a problem

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Astbury Road, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black Nissan empties rubbish on the road, 1st December
item.description:
Lw19 black nissan quashai, used by people who think it's acceptable to open their car doors and empty all their rubbish in to the street. The whole side of the road/gutter is full of their rubbish for about 10-15 meters. Something that is acceptable in their home country no doubt.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kendale Road, Downham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees branches are hitting telephone/ internet lines and needs major reducing/pollarding. Leaves continually block own drainage system which is currently doing., 1st December
item.description:
Tree needs major reduction of branches not just light pruning. Leaves are still falling and block own drainage system and branches hit internet cables causing loss of connections.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Lane, Hayes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
